ID: The system shall ensure that patientSafe remains true at all times during operation.
At all times; if FailSafeMode is active; then patientSafe must be true to ensure the patient remains protected whenever the system enters fail-safe operation.

When the ventilator switches from a non‑ventilation state into either PCVMode or PSVMode the system shall ensure that the inspiratoryPauseButton and the inspiratoryPause signal behave consistently with the mode transition. Specifically whenever PCVMode or PSVMode becomes active after being inactive the inspiratoryPauseButton shall not be pressed until the mode change is complete and the inspiratoryPause function shall only become active if the inspiratoryPauseButton has been pressed after the mode transition. The system shall not allow any inspiratoryPause or inspiratoryPauseButton activity that appears to have started before the current PCVMode or PSVMode period. This requirement ensures that the ventilator does not carry over any inspiratory pause state from a previous mode and that all pause actions are initiated by a deliberate button press after entering PCVMode or PSVMode.

The system shall ensure that StartUpDone has never been true in the past; or otherwise that once StartUpDone becomes true; it remains true until a newPatient or resumeVentilation event occurs.
